column4: mount: unknown filesystem type 'LVM2_member' -- I have a nearly hosed hard drive that I have connected via USB adapter...can anyone help me possibly bypass this error?
sounds like the filesystem type isn't being recongnised - is there data already on the disk?
it was an ubuntu install that a couple weeks ago decided to stop booting (hard drive going bad?)
do you get any output in your syslog?
you mean from the install that's on the USB hard drive that can't be mounted? No, grub wasn't able to load a partition
its sound to me that the ubuntu installer has installed onto aLVM group which it now can't find cause of the new instalation
any way to bypass so I can access the /home directory?
or is it completely hosed and has to be formatted
I'm not sure never had to get past that problem before Anyone else had to do this?
http://pissedoffadmins.com/index.php?entry=entry070507-105201
could also be LVM if you selected that at install time
Shadow6363, syslog sez [ 6853.494831]  EXT3-fs: Magic mismatch, very weird !
in a termial what does sudo cfdisk /dev/sdb show?
it says it's time to cry... because it shouldn't say NTFS like it does
arse :(
sure its the right disk?
well it's the only other disk attached to this thing besides the drive I boot to (which is 'buntu)
I wonder if the darksun package might have something for this situation
the darksun?
a package known as Darksun that contains stuff like ntfsundelete
it's not in any repos though it seems :-/ gotta boot to SLAX to use it
thanks for the help :)
